data.title: touch event pass to another layer?
data.body:
```
local _scene = cc.Scene:create()
local layer1 = ccs.GUIReader:getInstance():widgetFromJsonFile('res/CustomUI_25.json');

local function fun_1(sender, event)
    if event == ccui.TouchEventType.ended then
        sender:removeFromParent(true)
    end
end

local btn_1 = layer1:getChildByName("Button_1")
btn_1:addTouchEventListener(fun_1)

_scene:addChild(layer1);
cc.Director:getInstance():runWithScene(_scene)

local layer2 = cc.Layer:create()
local function onTouchesEnded(touches, event)
    print("onTouchesEnded")
end

local listener = cc.EventListenerTouchAllAtOnce:create()
listener:registerScriptHandler(onTouchesEnded,cc.Handler.EVENT_TOUCHES_ENDED )

local eventDispatcher = layer2:getEventDispatcher()
eventDispatcher:addEventListenerWithSceneGraphPriority(listener, layer2)
_scene:addChild(layer2)
```

I create a scene, and two layer added to it.
layer1 is a cocos studio layer, and have a button, I bind a touch event to it, in the function, I remove the button from the layer, it's ok! But the touch event passed to layer2, that's strange.
layer2 is a normal layer, and I create a AllAtOnce listener, and bind a function.
anybody can help me to figure it out? If button1's function not call removefromeparent, just do some print, it will swollow the event, layer2 is not trggle the listener.
I doubt that is this normal?

[Android] Cocos2dxHelper will not be initialized after activity recreate

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
Sometimes the devices will recreate the activity after application enter foreground, like too heavy memory load or on specified process policy.
You can use the development tools in Android settings to simulate it. In Settings > Developer options > Apps > Don't keep activities[turn on]

In this case, since the application go in background, the main activity will be destroyed, meanwhile the Cocos2dxHelper.sInited is still marked as "initialized" what will make Cocos2dxHelper not be initialized when application enter foreground.  This will lead to at least following issue:
Cocos2dxHelper.showDialog/Cocos2dxHelper.showEditTextDialog/Cocos2dxHelper.setEditTextDialogResult will not work.

After some tracking for Cocos2dxHelper source code, I found the "only initialize once" behavior is added for fixing following issue:http://cocos2d-x.org/issues/3723, but I cannot reproduce #3723 issue after removing the "only initialize once" logic. 

Could you check it?

data.title: [ci skip] Update the reference of submodule cocos2d-console.
[ci skip] Fix download section in readme
Add SpriteFrame support for AutoPolygon
data.body:
Right now AutoPolygon only supports generating PolygonInfo's from individual sprite files. We need to create them from a given SpriteFrame (loaded from SpriteFrameCache).

Currently, there's no direct way to do this.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
function name ‘“pToAngleSelf” in cocos2d.lua is easy to be misunderstood.
data.body:
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/scripting/lua-bindings/script/cocos2d/Cocos2d.lua

``` lua
function cc.pToAngleSelf(self)   --The atan2 returns radians, not angle
    return math.atan2(self.y, self.x)
end

function cc.pForAngle(a)    --Here the parameters with Angle
    return { x = math.cos(a), y = math.sin(a) }
End
```

The function name let a person is difficult to understand.
